qas.question: The goal of developing Bursa and Istanbul was an intentional act to create what?
Who did Mehmed and Bayezid encourage to come to Istanbul?

answers.text: the Jews from different parts of Europe

qas.question: What group were Jews being persecuted by in Europe?
Persecution of Jews in Spain occurred after what event concluded?

context: Ottoman government deliberately pursued a policy for the development of Bursa, Edirne, and Istanbul, successive Ottoman capitals, into major <a0_0>commercial and industrial centres<a0_0/>, considering that merchants and artisans were indispensable in creating a new metropolis. To this end, Mehmed and his successor <a1_0>Bayezid<a1_0/>, also encouraged and welcomed migration of <a2_0>the Jews from different parts of Europe<a2_0/>, who were settled in Istanbul and other port cities like Salonica. In many places in Europe, Jews were suffering persecution at the hands of <a3_0>their Christian counterparts<a3_0/>, such as in Spain after <a4_0>the conclusion of Reconquista<a4_0/>. The tolerance displayed by the Turks was welcomed by the immigrants.
